content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I don't like football but with a ton of reading, coding the solution is quick and easy :)

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very easy to understand and to solve

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It has a long statement but easy-to-understand goal and it's fairly easy to solve this problem.

Hello, I faced an issue doing your puzzle:
What if there are more than one player who earned the maximum points? e.g. for the input of:
2
NameA-ClubA-NationA-1-1-1-1
NameB-ClubB-NationB-1-1-0-3
The players have the same points of 33, so what the output be like? If there aren't such cases please mention it in the statement.
Thanks.

Input section
* Please add line numbers in <<bold>>: "<<Line 1>>:" and "<<Next [[N]] lines>>:".

* Please format "-" as a {{constant}} instead of a [[variable]].

* Please move the last sentence to Goal section.

Output section
* Please mention that all the output should be on a single line and all the elements should be separated by a space.

* Please change "Integers" to "Integer".

* Please change "of Points" to "for the total points".

Constraints section
* If there aren't any ties in players' points in each case, please mention so here.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write winner").

Cases
* Please avoid using non-ASCII characters in input. Suggest to remove those lines where non-ASCII characters are present.

Thanks.
Hello, first of all thanks for your time and advice, I definitely will, thank you very much üåπ
No problem. Please let me know when you're done updating the clash.

Hello, I have edited most of what you mentioned but I am confused about the meaning of this sentence " Please avoid using non-ASCII characters in input", because the tests only contain ASCII characters, Could you please clarify that?

Thank you for making the changes and your question. Non-ASCII characters refer to those accented characters, such as √©, √º and ƒá.

Comments not yet followed up:

Input section
* Please add "<<Next [[N]] lines>>:" to the front of the second line.

Output section
* Please change "on the same line must be" to "must be on the same line and".

Thanks again.
I have made all the edits, please if there is anything else that needs to be fixed, tell me about it, thank you for your time and your advice ‚òëÔ∏è

Two issues remain:

Output section
* Please change "on the same line must be" to "must be on the same line and".

Cases
* In "Only midfielders" Test, there is still a player's name with a non-ASCII character (√©). Please fix it.

Thanks.
